meanings.definition: Open to more than one interpretation; having a double meaning.
meanings.sent1: The ambiguous message left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent2: Her ambiguous smile made it hard to know if she was happy or sad.
meanings.sent3: The ambiguous note on the fridge made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: His ambiguous answer was like a riddle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The shadow cast an ambiguous figure on the wall.

meanings.sent1: The directions were so ambiguous that we got lost.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's explanation was so ambiguous that no one understood.
meanings.sent3: The ambiguous signpost led us in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her expression was as ambiguous as a foggy morning.
meanings.sent5: The map's ambiguous markings confused the travelers.

meanings.definition: Able to be understood in more than one way.
meanings.sent1: The painting's ambiguous beauty captivated the viewers.
meanings.sent2: His ambiguous statement could be taken as a compliment or an insult.
meanings.sent3: The ambiguous puzzle delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: The song's ambiguous lyrics resonated with different listeners.
meanings.sent5: The ambiguous decision left everyone with different opinions.
